message: I've re-read the last book now, and still am not quite clear about the whole wand thing. Can anyone lay it out clearly?
Wizards are innately magical, but the wands serve to amplify and focus their power so that it can be more controlled and directed. God forgive me for knowing that.
lol I get the wand/wizard thing, but I found it hard to keep track of which wand was who's, how they changed hands, how they ended up where they did. All of that is so important to the ending.
someone must have diagrammed somewhere
it made sense to me when i read it, but now I can't remember the exact sequence
maybe look up "wandlore" on the HP wiki?
Grindelwald -> Dumbledore (by that famous duel)
Dumbledore -> Draco Malfoy (Disarms on the ramparts when Dumbledore freezes Harry). Voldemort mistakes kills Snape because he does not know about the disarming
Malfoy ->Harry. Harry disarms Draco while escaping from Malfoy Manor
Hence Harry is the true owner. Hope it is clear
How comes that Harry disarms Draco, if Draco has the most powerful wand?
@synecdoche That actually helps - thanks! But also good question @snipsley. And I forget what makes a wizard the "true" owner. Obviously it's not just having it. Anyone?
A wizard becomes the true owner of  the Elder wand when he kills/disarms the previous owner

Regarding @Snipsley's question, Draco never really physically possesses the Elder Wand though he is the rightful owner. The Elder Wand is buried with Dumbledore.Thats why Voldemort breaks open his tomb. Harry disarms Malfoy's original wand. This should help http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elder_Wand#Elder_Wand
Thanks again @synecdouche! The link really helped, but I had to read it 3 times to really get it.

@synecdouche Thanks, so... Draco was the rightful owner, but he didn't carry the wand, so he could be easily defeated. And when he was defeated by Harry, Harry is now the righful owner, even if he doesn't carry the wand too. So for Voldy it's useless. Thanks!
This is really awesome and CRUCIAL information for the ending. I hope it's made clear in the movie.
Yeah, hope its made clear in the movie. BTW, which do you think is the best movie in the series so far?
Hmmm...I'll have to think about that.
By the way, how did Dumbledore defeat Grindelwald?
He was just so good, he defeated even the Elder wand?
yeah :)
What a badass.
